content: La mail non è stata aperta né con altro software né con webmail. Semplicemente l'ho aperta con Thunderbird. Alcune mail (ma non tutte) vengono visualizzate mostrando del codice come mostrato nell'immagine allegata. E' come se Thunderbird non fosse in grado di mostrarne il contenuto e facendo vedere il contenuto in modo testo non codificato. content:
I tend to agree with you, but I can't offer any methods.

Fundamentally for Thunderbird it is not so much a problem as in the core of things not much changed from the time Thunderbird support migrated to this site until version 115 was released. Even then it is more user interface changes than capabilities.

Does this have something to do with https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1444449 in which case nothing relevant has changed and you will be going through the same sort of diagnostics now as you would have years ago.
creator: MattAuSupport

creator: davidsk

content: Using the flatpak version perhaps? is paste allowed between flatpak sandboxes and the operating system?
creator: MattAuSupport

content: - install import-export addon if not already done - switch to first profile - highlight desired message folder, rightclick and select import-export entry and select to export as eml files to a local directory - repeat for each message folder, exporting to same local directory - switch to next profile and repeat the process - when done, switch to master profile - create new Local Folder to retain the exported messagess - highlight the folder and select the import-export option to import eml files - install the 'removedupes' addon to remove duplicates
creator: davidsk
